on geopolitics this is certainly the
case with Iran but that's obviously an
incomplete picture of a country with a
very complex society and a long and rich
tradition of art and culture including
movies like Abbas Kiarostami 's 1997
masterpiece taste of cherry now to an
American viewer the idioms the language
and the landscape of this film are
likely to be unfamiliar and exotic but
its themes are certainly accessible and
universal it's about friendship it's
about despair it's about our long
circuitous quest for meaning taste of
cherry is about a man driving through
the countryside looking for someone to
help him commit suicide he picks up
three different passengers and engages
them in a long and sometimes puzzling
conversations that's really about all
there is to it Karras Tommy alternates
close-up shots inside the car with long
wide shots that show it moving through
the landscape and the effect of this is

now where does this journey take us
exactly taste of cherry has one of the
most astonishing surprise endings in all
of cinema but it's not really a plot
twist and it doesn't answer some of our
basic questions about this man and his
quest instead the end changes your
perspective on what happens before as
the movie swerves from lyrical fable to
something like a documentary it becomes
if anything even more mysterious the
point of taste of cherry and the point
that it makes about life is that it's
not something to be interpreted or
analyzed it's something to be
experienced to be savored
